results.title: The Italian straw hat
results.brief_description: Farce about the Paris bourgeoisie. One visual detail after another creates a devastatingly witty satire at the expense of the French middle class. Set in Paris, 1895, the story concerns a bridegroom whose horse eats a Leghorn straw hat of a young married woman absorbed in a clandestine love affair. The wedding day must be interrupted while the groom searches frantically for an identical hat. Adapted from the play by Eugene Labiche and Marc Michel (II). Credits include: photographers, Maurice Desfassiaux, Nikolas Roudakoff; music, Jacques Ibert; editing, Henry Dobb; art designer, Lazare Meerson; costume design by Souplet; assistant directors, Lily Jumel and Georges Lacombe.

results.title: The Italian Peninsula
results.brief_description: A brief survey of the geography of Italy. A map is used to explain the position of the Alps and the Appennines and also the main cities and regions of the country. Illustrations include views of citrus groves in Southern Italy; Mt. Vesuvius; Naples; Rome, the city; St. Peter’s, the tomb of Hadrian; silk-worm culture; wheat and rice growing; hydro-electric plant in the Alps; factories in Milan.

results.title: The Italian job
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Michael Deeley and Peter Collinson
results.brief_description: When Charlie (Michael Caine) leaves jail he has the opportunity for a better future, or a sure fire way of landing back in jail when he inherits the plans to a $4,000,000 gold robbery. Things look positive when Charlie receives inside help from prison-based Mr Bridger (Noel Coward), who is the mastermind behind the plan. Central to the plan’s success is staging the world’s biggest traffic jam as a diversion to their shady activities. Cast includes Benny Hill, Raf Vallone and Tony Beckley. Music by Quincy Jones.

results.title: The Israelis
results.brief_description: Examines the current state of the culture and people of the country of Israel. Explores the relationship of Jews and Arabs in the aftermath of recent hostilities, and shows how Israelis relate to their own Jewish heritage.

results.title: The Isle of Rhum
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland and Christopher Mylne
results.brief_description: A film about the Hebridean Island off the coast of Scotland. Here wild natural beauty contrasts with the Edwardian elegance of Kinlock Castle, the Nature Conservancy’s most ambitious experiment.

results.title: The Isle of joy
results.brief_description: Shapes and stars, fish and boats swim, fly and sail across the screen to the music of Claude Debussy (“L’isle Joyeuse”). Paperdoll people change into birds and back again dancing, piping, running, flying. Based on the collages and line drawings of Henri Matisse, this gayly coloured animated film should please every age group.

results.title: The Islands of Torres Strait
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Land Australia with Ted Egan”.
Torres Strait is a treacherous waterway between Cape York, the northern most tip of the Australian mainland and Papua New Guinea. The shallow strait is dotted with Islands and coral outcrops. From Possession Island at the southern extremity, Captain James Cook formally laid claim to the Australian colonies in the name of England. Later the Queensland Government moved to control the Islands of the Strait and their people. Once, the islanders currency of trade was human heads, and headhunting raids between the islands and mainland Papua New Guinea was part of life. On this journey through the islands, Ted Egan meets some old friends, sees dugout canoes being built and meets the keeper of the legendary Drums of Mer.

results.title: The Islanders
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: Aspects of life in the Torres Strait Islands, showing the rich culture of the people with their songs and dances, set against bright tropical backgrounds, in striking contrast to many parts of Australia. Shows how strongly the old traditions still affect the people, even though they have modern schools, shops, out-board motors and transistors.

results.title: The Island of Nevawuz
results.creator_credit: Fable Films Productions and Paul Williams
results.brief_description: Nevawuz is an idyllic and underdeveloped island in danger of corruption. J.B. Trumphorn, a corporate boss attempts to industrialize the island by using it’s natural source of oil. Aided by the King’s nephew his plan works, polluting the island as a result. Resistance to Trumphorn comes in the form of the young islander, Otto, and his dog Spot, who lead the islanders in a defence of Nevawuz. An instructive and entertaining video for children on the issue of pollution and industrialization. The video also includes “The True story of Ned Kelly” and “Ned Kelly’s dastardly dilemma”. All three tales are written and produced by Paul Williams.
